metadata.title: CVE-2019-11705 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw in Thunderbird's implementation of iCal causes a stack bufferoverflow in icalrecur_add_bydayrules when processing certain emailmessages, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerabilityaffects Thunderbird < 60.7.1.

criterions.comment: thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
